element.name: Ancient Symbol by toczygroszek (maintained by Jumpin Jiminie), Multi-cache (2/1.5)
element.description: This multicache (all stages and the final cache) is located in the centre of Dublin. It is probably best to attempt finding this cache walking, the whole route is approximately 2,5 km.

long-description.p: Many people consider swastika an inglorious symbol of fascism and nazism. But this symbol is much older than 2nd World War and its meaning stands just in opposition to Hitler's ideology. In many cultures and religions on all continents (excluding Australia) it is the symbol of the good, happiness, brightness, life and the sun. In sanskrit „svastika” means „directing to luck". The oldest known swastika is 12,000 years old! Swastika was most popular in Europe and Asia, first as a religious symbol, and later as an ornamental sign. It is still a religious symbol in hinduism, buddism and many ethnic religions; you can also find it in celtic and old christian art.

center.i: Detail from ancient Irish grave slab

long-description.p:
Some mystics say, you can't using swastika against other people, so when Hitler did that, his defeat was unavoidable.
The most famous swastika in Dublin was in the logo of a company „Swastika Laundry", established in 1912, and located on Shelbourne Road, Ballsbridge. They used electric vans for delivery. This company existed until 1960s (still with swastika in logo!), when it was bought by another laundry company, and logo was changed.
Today you can find some swastikas in architecture of Dublin if you are looking carefully. Most popular is the swastika pattern copied from original ancient Greek ornament.

After this short lesson there is time for finding the cache. But first you need to visit some places with swastikas and take a note of some information.
1. First stage is close to the Dublin Spire, at coordinates N 53° 21.002 W 006° 15.557. There is a nice pub with a mosaic in the front. On both sides of the door you can see vertical patterns composed of golden swastikas. Above the name of this pub you would see two words. Sum up all letters in the two words and call it A.
2. Now you can go to N 53° 20.922 W 006° 15.572. Above the windows at 1st floor you can see a horizontal pattern of swastikas. What is the number of the building? It is a two digit number, call it BC.
3. Not far from there, at coordinates N 53° 20.888 W 006° 15.555 there is a building, where a bank is located. Above the main door there is an arch where you can see a swastika pattern. High, on the front this building, there is a large name of a previous bank in this building. There are four words in that name. Count the number of letters in 2nd word in that name and call it D. Attention, that name is different than the name of the bank which is there now!
4. Next place is another bank building. Stay at coordinates N 53° 20.672 W 006° 15.618 and look up. You would see patterns of swastikas on the ceiling. How many parallel patterns can you see on this part (left wing) of the ceiling? Call it E. To check, subtract 5 from the number of swastikas in one pattern.
5. Now, at coordinates N 53° 20.605 W 006° 15.609 you can find a grey building with small swastikas on the top of the pillars in the front. Above you should see a date. Call the last two digits FG.
6. This is your last step before you find the cache. Go to coordinates N 53° 20.280 W 006° 15.502 and look up. What can you see? The sun of course! But not the real one – on the ceiling there is a painted sun, and around it there are solar symbols. One of those is swastika. How many solar symbols (include swastika) can you see? Call it H.
7. The final cache is at coordinates:
N 53 FG.EHA W 006 BC.DFG
The cache is a big tupperware box with some goodies and FTF prize. High buildings at the preliminary stages and tree cover at the final location make this cache harder to find. Stage no. 6 and the final spot are located in areas which are closed in the evening.
Closing times:
Dec-Jan: 4.30 PM
Feb: 5 PM
March: 6 PM, 7 PM
April: 8 PM
May: 9 PM
June-July: 9.30 PM
Aug: 9 PM
Sept: 8 PM
Oct: 7 PM, 6 PM
Nov: 5 PM

p.b: Please replace the cache carefully and EXACTLY as you have found it!

long-description.i: This cache will be maintained by Jumpin Jiminie

ul.li:
2010-06-07T19:00:00Z : Found it by de Bontjes
Together with 4-voeters we did this nice multi that shows you different places in Dublin. After we did the webcam we started with this one yesterday evening. When we arived at WP6 we discoverd the place was closed. So we decided to have a nice diner in stead and continued our search the next day. T4tc logged at 11:30 In : TB Out : TB
This entry was edited by de Bontjes on Sunday, 13 June 2010 at 23:32:50.

2010-06-07T19:00:00Z : Found it by 4voeters
A very nice multi that shows you different places in Dublin. After we did the webcam we started with this one yesterday evening. When we arived at WP6 we discoverd the place was closed. So we decided to have a nice diner in stead and continued our search the next day. Thanks a lot for this beautifull tour around the town.
logged at 11:30
Out: Canadian coin Out: Duck In : Spiderman

2010-06-05T19:00:00Z : Found it by eve1987
A really great multi-cache with a grandios final and a good story [ ;)]
I loved it - and I am happy that it was my #1000!
Thanks a lot for the nice walk through the city and the cache! Eve

2010-06-05T19:00:00Z : Found it by GudrunXY
It took us a while to find all the correct answers. Nice idea and really interesting to find the symbol all over Dublin. TFTC, GudrunXY

2010-06-05T19:00:00Z : Write note by eve1987
left 2 coins there... also my own Coin, a new one! (my log will come when i am at home)
OUT: TB

2009-01-17T20:00:00Z : Write note by Kersti.com
And this one

2009-01-17T20:00:00Z : Write note by Kersti.com
Logging TBs in

2008-10-17T19:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
A lovely day for a spot of multi-clue hunting. I have fond memories of the last one that was here as it was my one and only FTF - shame it disappeared but a great replacement! Good to see too that this one is large enough to accept some pretty big TBs if anyone is weighed down by them. TFTC

wpt.name: GC1EQ2H
wpt.desc: Ancient Symbol by toczygroszek (maintained by Jumpin Jiminie), Multi-cache (2/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Ancient Symbol
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: This multicache (all stages and the final cache) is located in the centre of Dublin. It is probably best to attempt finding this cache walking, the whole route is approximately 2,5 km.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Many people consider swastika an inglorious symbol of fascism and nazism. But this symbol is much older than 2nd World War and its meaning stands just in opposition to Hitler's ideology. In many cultures and religions on all continents (excluding Australia) it is the symbol of the good, happiness, brightness, life and the sun. In sanskrit „svastika” means „directing to luck". The oldest known swastika is 12,000 years old! Swastika was most popular in Europe and Asia, first as a religious symbol, and later as an ornamental sign. It is still a religious symbol in hinduism, buddism and many ethnic religions; you can also find it in celtic and old christian art.



Detail from ancient Irish grave slab

Some mystics say, you can't using swastika against other people, so when Hitler did that, his defeat was unavoidable.

The most famous swastika in Dublin was in the logo of a company „Swastika Laundry", established in 1912, and located on Shelbourne Road, Ballsbridge. They used electric vans for delivery. This company existed until 1960s (still with swastika in logo!), when it was bought by another laundry company, and logo was changed.



Swastika Laundry van

Today you can find some swastikas in architecture of Dublin if you are looking carefully. Most popular is the swastika pattern copied from original ancient Greek ornament.



Swastika pattern

After this short lesson there is time for finding the cache. But first you need to visit some places with swastikas and take a note of some information.

1. First stage is close to the Dublin Spire, at coordinates N 53° 21.002 W 006° 15.557. There is a nice pub with a mosaic in the front. On both sides of the door you can see vertical patterns composed of golden swastikas. Above the name of this pub you would see two words. Sum up all letters in the two words and call it A.

2. Now you can go to N 53° 20.922 W 006° 15.572. Above the windows at 1st floor you can see a horizontal pattern of swastikas. What is the number of the building? It is a two digit number, call it BC.

3. Not far from there, at coordinates N 53° 20.888 W 006° 15.555 there is a building, where a bank is located. Above the main door there is an arch where you can see a swastika pattern. High, on the front this building, there is a large name of a previous bank in this building. There are four words in that name. Count the number of letters in 2nd word in that name and call it D. Attention, that name is different than the name of the bank which is there now!

4. Next place is another bank building. Stay at coordinates N 53° 20.672 W 006° 15.618 and look up. You would see patterns of swastikas on the ceiling. How many parallel patterns can you see on this part (left wing) of the ceiling? Call it E. To check, subtract 5 from the number of swastikas in one pattern.

5. Now, at coordinates N 53° 20.605 W 006° 15.609 you can find a grey building with small swastikas on the top of the pillars in the front. Above you should see a date. Call the last two digits FG.

6. This is your last step before you find the cache. Go to coordinates N 53° 20.280 W 006° 15.502 and look up. What can you see? The sun of course! But not the real one – on the ceiling there is a painted sun, and around it there are solar symbols. One of those is swastika. How many solar symbols (include swastika) can you see? Call it H.

7. The final cache is at coordinates:
N 53 FG.EHA W 006 BC.DFG

The cache is a big tupperware box with some goodies and FTF prize. High buildings at the preliminary stages and tree cover at the final location make this cache harder to find. Stage no. 6 and the final spot are located in areas which are closed in the evening.

Closing times:
Dec-Jan: 4.30 PM
Feb: 5 PM
March: 6 PM, 7 PM
April: 8 PM
May: 9 PM
June-July: 9.30 PM
Aug: 9 PM
Sept: 8 PM
Oct: 7 PM, 6 PM
Nov: 5 PM


Please replace the cache carefully and EXACTLY as you have found it!



This cache will be maintained by Jumpin Jiminie



Additional Waypoints

S11EQ2H - Stage1
N 53° 21.002 W 006° 15.557

S21EQ2H - Stage2
N 53° 20.922 W 006° 15.572

S31EQ2H - Stage3
N 53° 20.888 W 006° 15.555

S41EQ2H - Stage4
N 53° 20.672 W 006° 15.618

S51EQ2H - Stage5
N 53° 20.605 W 006° 15.609

S61EQ2H - Stage6
N 53° 20.280 W 006° 15.502

XX1EQ2H - The Cache
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
